REZINAGRO-OC )RPI ,noitcetorP remusnoC ,waL noititepmoC ,PECR( RDP oaL ,enaitneiV ni 3102 ranimeS gnidliuB yticapaC )RPI ,noitcetorP remusnoC ,waL noititepmoC ,PECR( RDP oaL ,enaitneiV ni 3102 ranimeS gnidliuB yticapaC";s:9:"published";s:1:"1";s:9:"highlight";s:1:"0";s:8:"order_id";s:3:"100";s:12:"created_date";s:19:"2014-01-15 17:18:13";s:13:"modified_date";s:19:"2018-01-23 10:38:30";s:11:"modified_by";s:2:"11";s:7:"old_url";s:118:"/capacity_building/seminar_workshop/2014/01/eria-organizes-capacity-building-seminar-and-workshop-2013-in-lao-pdr.html";s:10:"majorEmail";N;s:9:"education";N;s:10:"experience";N;s:12:"publications";N;s:6:"others";N;s:13:"presentations";s:0:"";s:7:"feature";N;s:11:"sub_experts";s:1:"1";s:15:"sub_dep_experts";N;s:13:"meta_keywords";N;s:16:"meta_description";N;s:5:"sc_id";s:1:"0";}i:264;O:8:"stdClass":46:{s:9:"short_des";N;s:10:"article_id";s:3:"980";s:12:"article_type";s:8:"articles";s:3:"uri";s:98:"capacity-building-seminar-2013-in-phnom-penh-cambodia-rcep-competition-law-consumer-protection-ipr";s:8:"pub_type";s:1:"0";s:5:"title";s:104:"Capacity Building Seminar 2013 in Phnom Penh, Cambodia (RCEP, Competition Law, Consumer Protection, IPR)";s:11:"posted_date";s:10:"2013-10-31";s:11:"posted_year";s:4:"2013";s:12:"posted_month";s:2:"10";s:7:"content";s:2627:"<h2>CO-ORGANIZER</h2><hr /><p>Ministry of Commerce, the Kingdom of Cambodia</p><h2>Supported by</h2><hr /><p>Bangkok Research Center (BRC), JETRO Bangkok</p><div class="clear">&nbsp;</div><hr /><p>The Seminar and Workshop was conducted at Sofitel Phnom Penh Phokeethra Hotel, Cambodia on October 31 and November 1, 2013. With topic on RCEP, Competition Law, Consumer Protection, IPR, the two-day seminar "Strengthening Cambodia&#039;s Competitiveness" was organized by Economic Research Institute for ASEAN and East Asia (ERIA) and Ministry of Commerce, the Kingdom of Cambodia, supported by Bangkok Research Center, JETRO Bangkok.</p><p>H.E Mr. Sun Chanthol, Senior Minister, Minister of Commerce, the Kingdom of Cambodia and Prof. Hidetoshi Nishimura, Executive Director, ERIA was opened the seminar with 300 participants from private sectors and educational academic and research institutes.</p><p>The prominent speakers were Dr. Hank Lim, Chairperson, Academic Advisory Council (AAC), ERIA, H.E. Mr. Ros Seilava, Undersecretary of State, Ministry of Economy and Finance, the Kingdom of Cambodia, Prof. Inkyo Cheong, Professor of Economic at Inha University, Incheon South Korea, Dr. Titik Anas, Economist, Departement of Economics, Centre for Strategic and International Studies (CSIS), Indonesia, Mr. Yoshifumi Fukunaga, Senior Policy Coordinator, ERIA, Mr. Oknha Te Taingpor, President, Federation of Associations for Small and Medium Entreprises of Cambodia, Mr. Masao Suematsu, COO &amp; Executive Vice President, DENSO International Asia Co.,Ltd., Thailand, Prof. Makoto Kurita, Professor, Law School, Chiba University, Japan, Dr. Vince Eng Teong See, LLB (Hons), Associate Fellow, UMCoRS, Malaysia, Prof. Viravat Chantachote, Professor, Faculty of Law, Thammasat University, Thailand, Mr. Shimpei Yamamoto, Managing Director for Reseacrh Affairs, ERIA, Mr. Var Roth San, Advisor to the Ministry of Commerce, Head of Secretariat of National Committee for IPR of Cambodia, H.E. Dr. Sok Siphana, Managing Partner, Sok Siphana &amp; Associates, Adviser to the Council for the Developmentof Cambodia (CDC) and Hiroshi Kato, Professor, Nihon University, Japan.</p><p>The seminar was a part of long-standing capacity building program since 2008 initiated by ERIA for the new ASEAN members (Cambodia, Lao PDR, Myanmar and Vietnam) on their efforts to integrate their economies with ASEAN.</p><p class="pdf"><a href="http://www.eria.org/capacity_building/seminar_workshop/Press%20Release%20Capacity%20Building%20Seminar%202013%20in%20Cambodia%20%28Oct%2031%29.pdf">Press Release - Cambodia Aims High in Economic Growth</a></p>";s:10:"image_name";s:94:"/uploads/articles/20131031/eria-capacity-building-2013-in-cambodia-thumb-448x299-2126-crop.jpg";s:9:"video_url";s:0:"";s:4:"tags";s:0:"";s:6:"editor";s:0:"";s:6:"author";s:0:"";s:6:"doc_no";s:0:"";s:6:"period";s:0:"";s:14:"article_status";s:1:"0";s:10:"event_time";s:5:"08:30";s:5:"venue";s:45:"Sofitel Phnom Penh Phokeethra Hotel, Cambodia";s:5:"major";s:0:"";s:16:"article_keywords";s:0:"";s:9:"organizer";s:0:"";s:12:"image_name_2";s:0:"";s:10:"start_date";s:10:"0000-00-00";s:8:"end_date";s:10:"0000-00-00";s:8:"keywords";s:5331:"Capacity Building Seminar 2013 in Phnom Penh, Cambodia (RCEP, Competition Law, Consumer Protection, IPR) Capacity Building Seminar 2013 in Phnom Penh, Cambodia (RCEP, Competition Law, Consumer Protection, IPR) CO-ORGANIZER

Ministry of Commerce, the Kingdom of Cambodia
Supported by

Bangkok Research Center (BRC), JETRO Bangkok
&nbsp;

The Seminar and Workshop was conducted at Sofitel Phnom Penh Phokeethra Hotel, Cambodia on October 31 and November 1, 2013. With topic on RCEP, Competition Law, Consumer Protection, IPR, the two-day seminar "Strengthening Cambodia's Competitiveness" was organized by Economic Research Institute for ASEAN and East Asia (ERIA) and Ministry of Commerce, the Kingdom of Cambodia, supported by Bangkok Research Center, JETRO Bangkok.
H.E Mr. Sun Chanthol, Senior Minister, Minister of Commerce, the Kingdom of Cambodia and Prof. Hidetoshi Nishimura, Executive Director, ERIA was opened the seminar with 300 participants from private sectors and educational academic and research institutes.
The prominent speakers were Dr. Hank Lim, Chairperson, Academic Advisory Council (AAC), ERIA, H.E. Mr. Ros Seilava, Undersecretary of State, Ministry of Economy and Finance, the Kingdom of Cambodia, Prof. Inkyo Cheong, Professor of Economic at Inha University, Incheon South Korea, Dr. Titik Anas, Economist, Departement of Economics, Centre for Strategic and International Studies (CSIS), Indonesia, Mr. Yoshifumi Fukunaga, Senior Policy Coordinator, ERIA, Mr. Oknha Te Taingpor, President, Federation of Associations for Small and Medium Entreprises of Cambodia, Mr. Masao Suematsu, COO &amp; Executive Vice President, DENSO International Asia Co.,Ltd., Thailand, Prof. Makoto Kurita, Professor, Law School, Chiba University, Japan, Dr. Vince Eng Teong See, LLB (Hons), Associate Fellow, UMCoRS, Malaysia, Prof. Viravat Chantachote, Professor, Faculty of Law, Thammasat University, Thailand, Mr. Shimpei Yamamoto, Managing Director for Reseacrh Affairs, ERIA, Mr. Var Roth San, Advisor to the Ministry of Commerce, Head of Secretariat of National Committee for IPR of Cambodia, H.E. Dr. Sok Siphana, Managing Partner, Sok Siphana &amp; Associates, Adviser to the Council for the Developmentof Cambodia (CDC) and Hiroshi Kato, Professor, Nihon University, Japan.
The seminar was a part of long-standing capacity building program since 2008 initiated by ERIA for the new ASEAN members (Cambodia, Lao PDR, Myanmar and Vietnam) on their efforts to integrate their economies with ASEAN.

REZINAGRO-OC )RPI ,noitcetorP remusnoC ,waL noititepmoC ,PECR( aidobmaC ,hneP monhP ni 3102 ranimeS gnidliuB yticapaC )RPI ,noitcetorP remusnoC ,waL noititepmoC ,PECR( aidobmaC ,hneP monhP ni 3102 ranimeS gnidliuB yticapaC";s:9:"published";s:1:"1";s:9:"highlight";s:1:"0";s:8:"order_id";s:2:"90";s:12:"created_date";s:19:"2014-01-09 22:02:46";s:13:"modified_date";s:19:"2018-01-23 10:43:16";s:11:"modified_by";s:2:"11";s:7:"old_url";s:119:"/capacity_building/seminar_workshop/2014/01/eria-organizes-capacity-building-seminar-and-workshop-2013-in-cambodia.html";s:10:"majorEmail";N;s:9:"education";N;s:10:"experience";N;s:12:"publications";N;s:6:"others";N;s:13:"presentations";s:0:"";s:7:"feature";N;s:11:"sub_experts";s:1:"1";s:15:"sub_dep_experts";N;s:13:"meta_keywords";N;s:16:"meta_description";N;s:5:"sc_id";s:1:"0";}i:265;O:8:"stdClass":46:{s:9:"short_des";N;s:10:"article_id";s:3:"979";s:12:"article_type";s:8:"articles";s:3:"uri";s:90:"executive-capacity-building-seminar-and-workshop-executive-leaders-summit-2013-in-thailand";s:8:"pub_type";s:1:"0";s:5:"title";s:92:"Executive Capacity Building Seminar and Workshop 'Executive Leaders Summit 2013 in Thailand'";s:11:"posted_date";s:10:"2013-10-21";s:11:"posted_year";s:4:"2013";s:12:"posted_month";s:2:"10";s:7:"content";s:3947:"<p>The Economic Research Institute for ASEAN and East Asia (ERIA) organised the ERIA Executive Capacity Building Program &#039;Executive Leaders Summit 2013 in Thailand&#039;, together with the Ministry of Commerce, the Kingdom of Thailand and supported by Bangkok Research Center (BRC), JETRO Bangkok, which started with the Executive Capacity Building Seminar &#039;Building Robust, Efficient and Value Creating Connectivity for Regional Development&#039; at Conrad Hotel Bangkok, Thailand on 21 October 2013, followed by the workshop and field trip in Chiang Mai and Chiang Rai until 25 October 2013.</p><p>The program aims to offer an opportunity to share experiences, academic findings and empirical practices, and to build network among participants. This is the first event DDGs from five countries are invited together to discuss about regional issues of connectivity and regional development.</p><p>Sixty participants including 15 representatives at the DDG level from Cambodia, Lao PDR, Viet Nam, Thailand and Myanmar attended the seminar, and the DDGs continue the program of five days (21-25 October 2013) to exchange views and map out their common strategies in future connectivity.</p><p>It was opened officially by H. E. Niwatthamrong Bunsongphaisan, Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Commerce, the Kingdom of Thailand and Prof. Hidetoshi Nishimura, Executive Director, ERIA.</p><p>The prominent speakers for the Executive Capacity Building Seminar on 21 October 2013 were H.E. Supachai Panitchpakdi, Former Secretary-General of the UN Conference on Trade and Development (UNCTAD); H.E. Olarn Chaipravat, Thailand Trade epresentative (TTR); Dr. Hank Lim, Chair Person, ERIA Academic Advisory Council (AAC); Dr Pattama Tearnravisitsagool, Senior Advisor in Policy and Plan, National Economic and Social Development Board (NESDB), Thailand; Prof Fukunari Kimura, Chief Economist of ERIA; Ms Vasana Mututanont, Former Deputy Secretary General, Thailand Board of Investment (BOI), Thailand; Dr Ram Upendra Das, Senior Fellow, the Research and Information System for Developing Countries (RIS), New Delhi, India; Prof Michael E. Regan, Professor, Bond University, Australia; and Dr Masami Ishida, Senior Research Fellow, Bangkok Research Center, JETRO Bangkok, Thailand.</p><p>After listening to a series of lectures from prominent leaders and economists in Bangkok on 21 October, they traveled to Chiang Mai and Chiang Rai to visit industrial parks in the area including leading companies invested in Northern Thailand on 22 October, Chiang Khong Bridge on 24 and Chiansaen Port on 25 October to see how those infrastructures will bring effect on the connectivity among neighboring countries and economically impact.</p><p>During the workshop on 22 October, the participants are divided into three distinctive groups focusing on commerce and trade, regional planning, as well as transportation and public works. Each group is supervised by experts related to trade, planning, and connectivity. The interaction within the group and various thematic discussions allow participants to exchange views and plan together.</p><h2>Co-organiser</h2><p>Ministry of Commerce, the Kingdom of Thailand</p><h2>Supported by</h2><p>Bangkok Research Center (BRC), JETRO Bangkok</p><h2 class="clear">&nbsp;Related Documents</h2><p class="pdf"><a href="http://www.eria.org/capacity_building/seminar_workshop/Press%20Release%20of%20The%20ERIA%20Executive%20Capacity%20Building%20Seminar%202013%20-%20Thailand.pdf">Press Release - GMS Connectivity: Key to Key Growth</a></p><p class="pdf"><a href="http://www.eria.org/capacity_building/seminar_workshop/CLMV-Thailand%20-%20Platform%20for%20Senior%20Executives%20to%20Discuss%20Regional%20Issues%20and%20Gain%20Better%20Understanding%20and%20Future%20Cooperation-1.pdf">CLMV-Thailand - Platform for Senior Executives to Discuss Regional Issues and Gain Better Understanding and Future Cooperation</a></p>";s:10:"image_name";s:64:"/uploads/articles/20131021/bit_8455-thumb-1000x668-2104-crop.jpg";s:9:"video_url";s:0:"";s:4:"tags";s:0:"";s:6:"editor";s:0:"";s:6:"author";s:0:"";s:6:"doc_no";s:0:"";s:6:"period";s:0:"";s:14:"article_status";s:1:"0";s:10:"event_time";s:5:"08:30";s:5:"venue";s:71:"Conrad Hotel, Bangkok, Shangri-La Chiang Mai and Le Meridien Chiang Rai";s:5:"major";s:0:"";s:16:"article_keywords";s:0:"";s:9:"organizer";s:0:"";s:12:"image_name_2";s:0:"";s:10:"start_date";s:10:"0000-00-00";s:8:"end_date";s:10:"0000-00-00";s:8:"keywords";s:7417:"Executive Capacity Building Seminar and Workshop 'Executive Leaders Summit 2013 in Thailand' Executive Capacity Building Seminar and Workshop 'Executive Leaders Summit 2013 in Thailand' The Economic Research Institute for ASEAN and East Asia (ERIA) organised the ERIA Executive Capacity Building Program 'Executive Leaders Summit 2013 in Thailand', together with the Ministry of Commerce, the Kingdom of Thailand and supported by Bangkok Research Center (BRC), JETRO Bangkok, which started with the Executive Capacity Building Seminar 'Building Robust, Efficient and Value Creating Connectivity for Regional Development' at Conrad Hotel Bangkok, Thailand on 21 October 2013, followed by the workshop and field trip in Chiang Mai and Chiang Rai until 25 October 2013.
The program aims to offer an opportunity to share experiences, academic findings and empirical practices, and to build network among participants. This is the first event DDGs from five countries are invited together to discuss about regional issues of connectivity and regional development.
Sixty participants including 15 representatives at the DDG level from Cambodia, Lao PDR, Viet Nam, Thailand and Myanmar attended the seminar, and the DDGs continue the program of five days (21-25 October 2013) to exchange views and map out their common strategies in future connectivity.
It was opened officially by H. E. Niwatthamrong Bunsongphaisan, Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Commerce, the Kingdom of Thailand and Prof. Hidetoshi Nishimura, Executive Director, ERIA.
The prominent speakers for the Executive Capacity Building Seminar on 21 October 2013 were H.E. Supachai Panitchpakdi, Former Secretary-General of the UN Conference on Trade and Development (UNCTAD); H.E. Olarn Chaipravat, Thailand Trade epresentative (TTR); Dr. Hank Lim, Chair Person, ERIA Academic Advisory Council (AAC); Dr Pattama Tearnravisitsagool, Senior Advisor in Policy and Plan, National Economic and Social Development Board (NESDB), Thailand; Prof Fukunari Kimura, Chief Economist of ERIA; Ms Vasana Mututanont, Former Deputy Secretary General, Thailand Board of Investment (BOI), Thailand; Dr Ram Upendra Das, Senior Fellow, the Research and Information System for Developing Countries (RIS), New Delhi, India; Prof Michael E. Regan, Professor, Bond University, Australia; and Dr Masami Ishida, Senior Research Fellow, Bangkok Research Center, JETRO Bangkok, Thailand.
After listening to a series of lectures from prominent leaders and economists in Bangkok on 21 October, they traveled to Chiang Mai and Chiang Rai to visit industrial parks in the area including leading companies invested in Northern Thailand on 22 October, Chiang Khong Bridge on 24 and Chiansaen Port on 25 October to see how those infrastructures will bring effect on the connectivity among neighboring countries and economically impact.
During the workshop on 22 October, the participants are divided into three distinctive groups focusing on commerce and trade, regional planning, as well as transportation and public works. Each group is supervised by experts related to trade, planning, and connectivity. The interaction within the group and various thematic discussions allow participants to exchange views and plan together.
Co-organiser
Ministry of Commerce, the Kingdom of Thailand
Supported by
Bangkok Research Center (BRC), JETRO Bangkok

10:45:21";s:11:"modified_by";s:2:"11";s:7:"old_url";s:124:"/capacity_building/seminar_workshop/2014/01/eria-organizes-executive-capacity-building-seminar-and-workshop-in-thailand.html";s:10:"majorEmail";N;s:9:"education";N;s:10:"experience";N;s:12:"publications";N;s:6:"others";N;s:13:"presentations";s:0:"";s:7:"feature";N;s:11:"sub_experts";s:1:"1";s:15:"sub_dep_experts";N;s:13:"meta_keywords";N;s:16:"meta_description";N;s:5:"sc_id";s:1:"0";}i:266;O:8:"stdClass":46:{s:9:"short_des";N;s:10:"article_id";s:3:"978";s:12:"article_type";s:8:"articles";s:3:"uri";s:52:"capacity-building-seminar-in-nay-pyi-taw-myanmar-ppp";s:8:"pub_type";s:1:"0";s:5:"title";s:55:"Capacity Building Seminar in Nay Pyi Taw, Myanmar (PPP)";s:11:"posted_date";s:10:"2013-07-24";s:11:"posted_year";s:4:"2013";s:12:"posted_month";s:1:"7";s:7:"content";s:3065:"<h2>CO-ORGANIZER</h2><hr /><p>Ministry of National Planning and Economic Development (NPED), Myanmar</p><h2>Supported by</h2><hr /><p>Bangkok Research Center (BRC), JETRO Bangkok, JETRO Yangon, Myanmar.</p><div class="clear">&nbsp;</div><hr /><p>The Seminar "Utilizing an Efficient Infrastructure Development Framework" with the topic of Public-Private Partnership (PPP) was organized by Economic Research Institute for ASEAN and East Asia (ERIA) and co-organized by Ministry of National Planning and Economic Development (NPED), Myanmar and supported by Bangkok Research Center, JETRO Bangkok and JETRO Yangon on July 24, 2013 in Nay Pyi Taw, Myanmar.</p><p>70 officials from various ministries and private sector attended the event. The main objectives of this seminar was aiming at achieving to disseminate the lessons on the PPP assessment study, provide examples from best practices in Australia, as a leading country in PPP experience and implementation, sharing basic ideas on the PPP scheme, to show its effectiveness to the key players in Lao PDR for her future infrastructure development and to present recommendations for reform, facilitate exchange of views among stakeholders in the country (contractors, government, financiers, academia) as well as with international experts from both public and private sector on the necessary steps towards implementing the PPP model, and encourage stakeholders in Lao PDR to take further steps to increase private sector participation in infrastructure development as well as to prepare for adoption of PPP policy through strong cooperation between public and private sector.</p><p>The key speakers of this seminar were Mr. Mario D&#039;Elia, Partner, Infrastructure Advisory, PWC Australia, Dr. Fauziah Zen, Researcher, ERIA, Indonesia, Prof. John A. Black, Emeritus Professor, University of New South Wales, Australia, Prof. Thida Khyu, Professor, Ministry of Education, Myanmar, Daw New Ni Win Kyaw, Assistant Director, Department of Civil Aviation, Ministry of Transport, Myanmar, Mr. Kel O&#039;Keefe, Legal Consultant, Sydney, Australia, Mr. Louie Ferrer, Chief marketing Officer, Megawide Corporation, Philippines and Dr. Leonie Lethbridge, Chief Operating Officer, PT. Bank ANZ Indonesia.</p><p>It was opened by H.E. Dr. Khin San Yee, Deputy Minister of National Planning and Economic Development (NPED), Myanmar and Prof. Yasuhiro Yamada, Special Assistant to the Executive Director of ERIA and President, Bangkok Research Center, IDE-JETRO.</p><p>Mr. Mario D&#039;Elia, Partner, Infrastructure Advisory, PWC, Australia, said that infrastructural projects must be chosen with care to ensure that they are sustainable and beneficial to the public.ERIA has conducted several studies in infrastructure development in ASEAN with emphasis on the utilization of private-sector participation.</p><p class="pdf"><a href="http://www.eria.org/capacity_building/seminar_workshop/Press%20Release%20PPP%20Seminar%20in%20Nay%20Pyi%20Taw.pdf">Press Release - Myanmar: PPP is Vital for Infrastructural Development</a></p>";s:10:"image_name";s:76:"/uploads/articles/20130724/naypyitawpppseminar-thumb-1985x1185-1935-crop.jpg";s:9:"video_url";s:0:"";s:4:"tags";s:0:"";s:6:"editor";s:0:"";s:6:"author";s:0:"";s:6:"doc_no";s:0:"";s:6:"period";s:0:"";s:14:"article_status";s:1:"0";s:10:"event_time";s:5:"08:30";s:5:"venue";s:40:"Fantastic Hall, Amara Hotel, Nay Pyi Taw";s:5:"major";s:0:"";s:16:"article_keywords";s:0:"";s:9:"organizer";s:0:"";s:12:"image_name_2";s:0:"";s:10:"start_date";s:10:"0000-00-00";s:8:"end_date";s:10:"0000-00-00";s:8:"keywords";s:6031:"Capacity Building Seminar in Nay Pyi Taw, Myanmar (PPP) Capacity Building Seminar in Nay Pyi Taw, Myanmar (PPP) CO-ORGANIZER

Ministry of National Planning and Economic Development (NPED), Myanmar
Supported by

Bangkok Research Center (BRC), JETRO Bangkok, JETRO Yangon, Myanmar.
&nbsp;

The Seminar "Utilizing an Efficient Infrastructure Development Framework" with the topic of Public-Private Partnership (PPP) was organized by Economic Research Institute for ASEAN and East Asia (ERIA) and co-organized by Ministry of National Planning and Economic Development (NPED), Myanmar and supported by Bangkok Research Center, JETRO Bangkok and JETRO Yangon on July 24, 2013 in Nay Pyi Taw, Myanmar.
70 officials from various ministries and private sector attended the event. The main objectives of this seminar was aiming at achieving to disseminate the lessons on the PPP assessment study, provide examples from best practices in Australia, as a leading country in PPP experience and implementation, sharing basic ideas on the PPP scheme, to show its effectiveness to the key players in Lao PDR for her future infrastructure development and to present recommendations for reform, facilitate exchange of views among stakeholders in the country (contractors, government, financiers, academia) as well as with international experts from both public and private sector on the necessary steps towards implementing the PPP model, and encourage stakeholders in Lao PDR to take further steps to increase private sector participation in infrastructure development as well as to prepare for adoption of PPP policy through strong cooperation between public and private sector.
The key speakers of this seminar were Mr. Mario D'Elia, Partner, Infrastructure Advisory, PWC Australia, Dr. Fauziah Zen, Researcher, ERIA, Indonesia, Prof. John A. Black, Emeritus Professor, University of New South Wales, Australia, Prof. Thida Khyu, Professor, Ministry of Education, Myanmar, Daw New Ni Win Kyaw, Assistant Director, Department of Civil Aviation, Ministry of Transport, Myanmar, Mr. Kel O'Keefe, Legal Consultant, Sydney, Australia, Mr. Louie Ferrer, Chief marketing Officer, Megawide Corporation, Philippines and Dr. Leonie Lethbridge, Chief Operating Officer, PT. Bank ANZ Indonesia.
It was opened by H.E. Dr. Khin San Yee, Deputy Minister of National Planning and Economic Development (NPED), Myanmar and Prof. Yasuhiro Yamada, Special Assistant to the Executive Director of ERIA and President, Bangkok Research Center, IDE-JETRO.
Mr. Mario D'Elia, Partner, Infrastructure Advisory, PWC, Australia, said that infrastructural projects must be chosen with care to ensure that they are sustainable and beneficial to the public.ERIA has conducted several studies in infrastructure development in ASEAN with emphasis on the utilization of private-sector participation.

He also extended his expectation that ERIA would support Cambodia in designing applicable steps to successfully introduce PPP System in Cambodia.</p><h2>Co-organiser</h2><p>Ministry of Commerce, Kingdom of Cambodia</p><h2>Supported by</h2><p>Cambodian Institute for Cooperation and Peace (CICP), Cambodia and Bangkok Research Center, IDE-JETRO, Thailand</p><div class="clear">&nbsp;</div><p class="pdf"><a href="http://www.eria.org/capacity_building/seminar_workshop/2013_0407_Cambodia%20Seeks%20More%20Participation%20from%20Private%20Sector.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Press Release - Cambodia Seeks More Participation from Private Sector</a></p>";s:10:"image_name";s:75:"/uploads/articles/20130704/ppp-seminar-in-pnh2-thumb-1296x864-1921-crop.jpg";s:9:"video_url";s:0:"";s:4:"tags";s:0:"";s:6:"editor";s:0:"";s:6:"author";s:0:"";s:6:"doc_no";s:0:"";s:6:"period";s:0:"";s:14:"article_status";s:1:"0";s:10:"event_time";s:5:"08:30";s:5:"venue";s:38:"Phnom Penh Hotel, Phnom Penh, Cambodia";s:5:"major";s:0:"";s:16:"article_keywords";s:0:"";s:9:"organizer";s:0:"";s:12:"image_name_2";s:0:"";s:10:"start_date";s:10:"0000-00-00";s:8:"end_date";s:10:"0000-00-00";s:8:"keywords";s:5803:"Capacity Building Seminar in Phnom Penh, Cambodia (PPP) Capacity Building Seminar in Phnom Penh, Cambodia (PPP) The ERIA Capacity Building "Utilizing an Efficient Infrastructure Development Framework" with the topic of Public-Private Partnership (PPP) was organized by Economic Research Institute for ASEAN and East Asia (ERIA) and co-organized by Ministry of Commerce, Kingdom of Cambodia and supported by the Cambodian Institute for Cooperation and Peace (CICP) and Bangkok Research Center, IDE-JETRO, Bangkok on Jult 4, 2013 in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.
More than 150 participants including government ministries, private companies, financiers, and legal practitioners. The speakers of this seminar were Mr. Daniel J. Graham, Director, NSW (New South Wales), Treasury, Australia, Dr. Fauziah Zen, Researcher, ERIA, Indonesia, Mr. Nik Nasir Majid, Independent Consultant, Malaysia, H.E. Tes Rikhaphal, Deputy Secretary General, Economic, Social and Cultural Council (ECOSOCC), Cambodia, Mr. Eleazar E. Ricote, Director IV, Public-Private Partnership (PPP) Center, Philippines, Mr. Oliver Tan, CFO, Megawide Construction Corporation, Philippines and Mr. Peter Brimble, Deputy Country Director and Senior Economist, ADB Cambodia.
It was opened by H.E. Dr. Cham Prasidh. Senior Minister and Minister of Commerce, Kingdom of Cambodia and Prof. Hidetoshi Nishimura, Executive Director, ERIA.
Mr. Daniel J. Graham, Director, New South Wales Treasury, Australia shared his thought on "What is PPP? Why is PPP framework necessary?" "Don't start a process unless a strong political commitment, funding, and consistent approaches to let private sector understand where they are in process and who is doing what" he said.
Dr. Fauziah Zen, Researcher, ERIA noted that there are some different situations among the ASEAN member countries-some countries in the ASEAN have too many and complicated regulations, while some still faced inadequate regulations and some countries lacked sufficient regulations.
Mr. Eleazar E. Ricote was haring the Philippines experience, recommended Cambodia to establish the clear role of the private sector, formalize PPP framework, Approval procedure, predictable procedure, necessary support systems, Keep track of performance of both private and public sectors, Communications.
The Seminar was closed by H.E. Pann Sorasak, Secretary of State of Ministry of Commerce, Kingdom of Cambodia. He also extended his expectation that ERIA would support Cambodia in designing applicable steps to successfully introduce PPP System in Cambodia.
Co-organiser
Ministry of Commerce, Kingdom of Cambodia

Cambodian Institute for Cooperation and Peace (CICP), Cambodia and Bangkok Research Center, IDE-JETRO, Thailand

The seminar focused on RCEP, SME, Competition Law, Consumer Protection, IPR ("Overcoming Challenges Ahead: Myanmar ASEAN Chair 2014, AEC and Beyond 2015"), together with the Ministry of National Planning and Economic Development (MNPED), Myanmar and supported by Bangkok Research Center (BRC) JETRO, Bangkok, JETRO Yangon and Yangon Institute of Economics, Myanmar.</p><p>More than 200 participants from various government agencies and private sectors attended the seminar. H.E Daw Lei Lei Thein, Deputy Minister of National Planning and Economic Development (MNPED) and Prof. Hidetoshi Nishimura, Executive Director, ERIA was welcomed the participants.</p><p>Speakers and moderator for RCEP were Dr. Hank Lim, Chairperson of ERIA Academic Advisory Council (AAC), Prof. Chang Jae Lee, Senior Research Fellow, Korea Institute for International Economic Policy (KIEP), South Korea; Dr. Titik Anas, Economist, Center of Strategic and International Studies (CSIS), Indonesia, Mr. Yoshifumi Fukunaga, Senior Policy Coordinator, ERIA, Mr. Masao Suematsu, COO and Executive Vice President, DENSO International Asia Co. Ltd, Thailand. Other speakers from Myanmar are Daw Khin Khin Nwe, Joint Secretary General, Union of Myanmar Federation of Chamber of Commerce and Industry (UMFCCI), Daw Than Than Lin, SEOM leader of Myanmar.</p><p>Speakers and moderator for SME on the second day were Mr. Antonio Fanelli, Deputy Head, Private Sector Development, OECD, Ms. Anita Richter, Policy Analyst, OECD, Dr. Sothea Oum, Economist, ERIA and Dr. Nu Nu Lwin, Visiting Research Fellow, The Asia Center, Seoul National University, South Korea. Dr. Ei Shweshin Tun, Ministry of Industry and Daw Khin Thida Nyein, Lecturer, Departement of Economics, Yangon Institute of Economics.</p><p>Speakers and moderator for Competition Law and Consumer Protection were Dr. Cassey Lee, Senior Lecturer, University of Wollongong, Australia, Dr. Vince Eng Teong See, LLB (Hons), Associate Fellow UMCoRS, Malaysia, Dr. Michael Schaper, Deputy Chairperson, Australian Competition and Consumer Commission, Australia, Mr. Shimpei Yamamoto, Managing Director for Research Affairs, ERIA, Dr. Aye Thiri Wai, Deputy Director, Ministry of Science and Technology, Myanmar and Mr. Hiroshi Kato, Professor, Nihon University, Japan.</p><h2>Co-organiser</h2><p>Ministry of National Planning and Economic Development of the Republic of the Union of Myanmar</p><h2>Supported by</h2><p>Bangkok Research Center (BRC) JETRO, Bangkok, JETRO Yangon and Yangon Institute of Economics, Myanmar</p><div class="clear">&nbsp;</div><p class="pdf"><a href="http://www.eria.org/capacity_building/seminar_workshop/Myanmar%20gears%20up%20for%20AEC%20and%20beyond.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Press Release - Myanmar gears up for AEC and beyond</a></p><p class="pdf"><a href="http://www.eria.org/capacity_building/seminar_workshop/SMEs%20Pivotal%20for%20Myanmar%20economic%20growth.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Press Release - SMEs Pivotal for Myanmar economic growth</a></p>";s:10:"image_name";s:66:"/uploads/articles/20131128/img_0265edt-thumb-800x333-2244-crop.jpg";s:9:"video_url";s:0:"";s:4:"tags";s:0:"";s:6:"editor";s:0:"";s:6:"author";s:0:"";s:6:"doc_no";s:0:"";s:6:"period";s:0:"";s:14:"article_status";s:1:"0";s:10:"event_time";s:5:"08:30";s:5:"venue";s:40:"The Thingaha Hotel, Nay Pyi Taw, Myanmar";s:5:"major";s:0:"";s:16:"article_keywords";s:0:"";s:9:"organizer";s:0:"";s:12:"image_name_2";s:0:"";s:10:"start_date";s:10:"0000-00-00";s:8:"end_date";s:10:"0000-00-00";s:8:"keywords";s:6093:"Capacity Building Seminar 2013 in Nay Pyi Taw, Myanmar (RCEP, SME, Competition Law, Consumer Protection, IPR) Capacity Building Seminar 2013 in Nay Pyi Taw, Myanmar (RCEP, SME, Competition Law, Consumer Protection, IPR) The three-day Capacity Building seminar in Nay Pyi Taw, Myanmar was held at Thingaha Hotel Nay Pyi Taw on November 28-30, 2013. The seminar focused on RCEP, SME, Competition Law, Consumer Protection, IPR ("Overcoming Challenges Ahead: Myanmar ASEAN Chair 2014, AEC and Beyond 2015"), together with the Ministry of National Planning and Economic Development (MNPED), Myanmar and supported by Bangkok Research Center (BRC) JETRO, Bangkok, JETRO Yangon and Yangon Institute of Economics, Myanmar.
More than 200 participants from various government agencies and private sectors attended the seminar. H.E Daw Lei Lei Thein, Deputy Minister of National Planning and Economic Development (MNPED) and Prof. Hidetoshi Nishimura, Executive Director, ERIA was welcomed the participants.
Speakers and moderator for RCEP were Dr. Hank Lim, Chairperson of ERIA Academic Advisory Council (AAC), Prof. Chang Jae Lee, Senior Research Fellow, Korea Institute for International Economic Policy (KIEP), South Korea; Dr. Titik Anas, Economist, Center of Strategic and International Studies (CSIS), Indonesia, Mr. Yoshifumi Fukunaga, Senior Policy Coordinator, ERIA, Mr. Masao Suematsu, COO and Executive Vice President, DENSO International Asia Co. Ltd, Thailand. Other speakers from Myanmar are Daw Khin Khin Nwe, Joint Secretary General, Union of Myanmar Federation of Chamber of Commerce and Industry (UMFCCI), Daw Than Than Lin, SEOM leader of Myanmar.
Speakers and moderator for SME on the second day were Mr. Antonio Fanelli, Deputy Head, Private Sector Development, OECD, Ms. Anita Richter, Policy Analyst, OECD, Dr. Sothea Oum, Economist, ERIA and Dr. Nu Nu Lwin, Visiting Research Fellow, The Asia Center, Seoul National University, South Korea. Dr. Ei Shweshin Tun, Ministry of Industry and Daw Khin Thida Nyein, Lecturer, Departement of Economics, Yangon Institute of Economics.
Speakers and moderator for Competition Law and Consumer Protection were Dr. Cassey Lee, Senior Lecturer, University of Wollongong, Australia, Dr. Vince Eng Teong See, LLB (Hons), Associate Fellow UMCoRS, Malaysia, Dr. Michael Schaper, Deputy Chairperson, Australian Competition and Consumer Commission, Australia, Mr. Shimpei Yamamoto, Managing Director for Research Affairs, ERIA, Dr. Aye Thiri Wai, Deputy Director, Ministry of Science and Technology, Myanmar and Mr. Hiroshi Kato, Professor, Nihon University, Japan.
Co-organiser
Ministry of National Planning and Economic Development of the Republic of the Union of Myanmar
Supported by
Bangkok Research Center (BRC) JETRO, Bangkok, JETRO Yangon and Yangon Institute of Economics, Myanmar

This Seminar also supported by Bangkok Research Center, JETRO Bangkok, Thailand on July 1, 2013 in Vientiane, Lao PDR</p><p>It was officially opened by H.E. Khmmani Pholsena, Vice Minister of Industry and Commerce, Lao PDR and Mr. Satoshi Kuwahara, Special Senior Advisor, Economic Research Institute for ASEAN and East Asia. The key speakers were Mr. Daniel J. Graham, Director, NSW (New South Wales) Treasury, Australia, Dr. Fauziah Zen, Researcher, ERIA, Indonesia, Prof. Michael Regan, Profesor of Infrastructure, Institute of Sustainable Development and Architecture, Bond University, Australia, Dr. Saykham Voladeth, National Economic Research Institute (NERI), Lao PDR, Mr. Eleazar E. Ricote, Director IV, Public-Private Partnership (PPP) and Mr. Oliver Tan, Megawide Corporation, Philippines.</p><p>The main objectives of this seminar was aiming at achieving to disseminate the lessons on the PPP assessment study, provide examples from best practices in Australia, as a leading country in PPP experience and implementation, sharing basic ideas on the PPP scheme, to show its effectiveness to the key players in Lao PDR for her future infrastructure development and to present recommendations for reform, facilitate exchange of views among stakeholders in the country (contractors, government, financiers, academia) as well as with international experts from both public and private sector on the necessary steps towards implementing the PPP model, and encourage stakeholders in Lao PDR to take further steps to increase private sector participation in infrastructure development as well as to prepare for adoption of PPP policy through strong cooperation between public and private sector.</p><p>Mr. Daniel J. Graham shared the concept of PPP and Australia&#039;s experience on PPP framework and the necessity of having PPP in place as well as the PPP institutional and legal framework.</p><p>Dr. Fauziah Zen, Researcher, ERIA, Indonesia, explained the ASEAN countries&#039; different stages of infrastructure policy, financing method, and financial capacity and introduced lessons from other countries.</p><p>Prof. Michael E. Regan made some important suggestion for Lao PDR on developing the PPP framework, for instance, to establish good foundations and adopt a staged approach to introduction of PPP policy (3 or 5 years) and to build on the BOT experience within government.</p><p>Dr. Saykham Voladeth, informed that PPP in Lao PDR is not new, but unsystematic. There is no specific PPP law; however, there are some elements of PPP in many laws such as Enterprise Law, Investment Law, Public Investment Law, Regulation on Bidding, Anti-corruption law, Decree on Completion, etc.</p><h2>Co-organiser</h2><p>Ministry of Industry and Commerce (MOIC), Lao PDR</p><h2>Supported by</h2><p>Bangkok Research Center (BRC), JETRO Bangkok, Thailand</p><div class="clear">&nbsp;</div><p class="pdf"><a href="http://www.eria.org/capacity_building/seminar_workshop/2013_0107_Lao%20PDR%20Increases%20Interests%20in%20Efficient%20Infrastructure%20Development%20Framework.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Press Release - Lao PDR Increases Interests in Efficient Infrastructure Development Framework</a></p>";s:10:"image_name";s:64:"/uploads/articles/20130701/img_7356-thumb-1296x864-1919-crop.jpg";s:9:"video_url";s:0:"";s:4:"tags";s:0:"";s:6:"editor";s:0:"";s:6:"author";s:0:"";s:6:"doc_no";s:0:"";s:6:"period";s:0:"";s:14:"article_status";s:1:"0";s:10:"event_time";s:5:"08:30";s:5:"venue";s:33:"Mercure Hotel, Vientiane, Lao PDR";s:5:"major";s:0:"";s:16:"article_keywords";s:0:"";s:9:"organizer";s:0:"";s:12:"image_name_2";s:0:"";s:10:"start_date";s:10:"0000-00-00";s:8:"end_date";s:10:"0000-00-00";s:8:"keywords";s:6639:"Capacity Building Seminar in Vientiane, Lao PDR (PPP) Capacity Building Seminar in Vientiane, Lao PDR (PPP) The ERIA Capacity Building seminar "Utilizing Efficient Infrastructure Development Framework" was organized by Economic Research Institute for ASEAN and East Asia (ERIA) and the co-organized by Ministry of Industry and Commerce (MOIC), Lao PDR. This Seminar also supported by Bangkok Research Center, JETRO Bangkok, Thailand on July 1, 2013 in Vientiane, Lao PDR
It was officially opened by H.E. Khmmani Pholsena, Vice Minister of Industry and Commerce, Lao PDR and Mr. Satoshi Kuwahara, Special Senior Advisor, Economic Research Institute for ASEAN and East Asia. The key speakers were Mr. Daniel J. Graham, Director, NSW (New South Wales) Treasury, Australia, Dr. Fauziah Zen, Researcher, ERIA, Indonesia, Prof. Michael Regan, Profesor of Infrastructure, Institute of Sustainable Development and Architecture, Bond University, Australia, Dr. Saykham Voladeth, National Economic Research Institute (NERI), Lao PDR, Mr. Eleazar E. Ricote, Director IV, Public-Private Partnership (PPP) and Mr. Oliver Tan, Megawide Corporation, Philippines.
The main objectives of this seminar was aiming at achieving to disseminate the lessons on the PPP assessment study, provide examples from best practices in Australia, as a leading country in PPP experience and implementation, sharing basic ideas on the PPP scheme, to show its effectiveness to the key players in Lao PDR for her future infrastructure development and to present recommendations for reform, facilitate exchange of views among stakeholders in the country (contractors, government, financiers, academia) as well as with international experts from both public and private sector on the necessary steps towards implementing the PPP model, and encourage stakeholders in Lao PDR to take further steps to increase private sector participation in infrastructure development as well as to prepare for adoption of PPP policy through strong cooperation between public and private sector.
Mr. Daniel J. Graham shared the concept of PPP and Australia's experience on PPP framework and the necessity of having PPP in place as well as the PPP institutional and legal framework.
Dr. Fauziah Zen, Researcher, ERIA, Indonesia, explained the ASEAN countries' different stages of infrastructure policy, financing method, and financial capacity and introduced lessons from other countries.
Prof. Michael E. Regan made some important suggestion for Lao PDR on developing the PPP framework, for instance, to establish good foundations and adopt a staged approach to introduction of PPP policy (3 or 5 years) and to build on the BOT experience within government.
Dr. Saykham Voladeth, informed that PPP in Lao PDR is not new, but unsystematic. There is no specific PPP law; however, there are some elements of PPP in many laws such as Enterprise Law, Investment Law, Public Investment Law, Regulation on Bidding, Anti-corruption law, Decree on Completion, etc.
Co-organiser
Ministry of Industry and Commerce (MOIC), Lao PDR
Supported by
Bangkok Research Center (BRC), JETRO Bangkok, Thailand

Vietnam</p><h2>Supported by</h2><hr /><p>Central Institute for Economic Management (CIEM), Bangkok Research Center (BRC), JETRO Bangkok, JETRO, Ha Noi,</p><div class="clear">&nbsp;</div><hr /><p>Economic Research Institute for ASEAN and East Asia (ERIA) together with Ministry of Industry and Trade Viet Nam organized the ERIA Capacity Building Symposium in Ha Noi, Viet Nam, on August 12, 2014, supported by Central Institute for Economic Management (CIEM), Viet Nam, Bangkok Research Center (BRC), JETRO Bangkok and JETRO Ha Noi. The Symposium was held at Intercontinental Hanoi Westlake Hotel, Viet Nam.</p><p>The symposium focused on &#039;Upgrading Viet Nam&#039;s Position towards AEC 2015 and beyond&#039;. Over 100 Vietnamese representatives from concerned ministries, private sectors and think-tanks attend the one-day symposium to promote their overall capacity to fulfill the economic integration under the ASEAN Economic Community (AEC).</p><p>The symposium also attended by H.E. Le Luong Minh, Secretary General of ASEAN to give his keynote speech, H.E. Nguyen Cam Tu, Deputy Minister, Ministry of Industry and Trade, Viet Nam and Prof. Hidetoshi Nishimura, Executive Director of ERIA</p><p>The prominent speakers for the symposium were Dr. Ponciano S. Intal Jr., Senior Researcher, ERIA, Dr. Vo Tri Thanh, Vice President, Central Institute for Economic Management (CIEM), Viet Nam, Mr. Nguyen Van Thach, Deputy Director General, Ministry of Transport, Viet Nam, Mr. Do Xuan Quang, Chairman, Vietnam Logistics Business Association, Mr. Atsushi Nagashima, President, Nippon Express (Viet Nam) Co., Ltd., Mrs. Bhui Thi Ngoc, General Director, Ngoc Ha, Viet Nam, Dr. Yasushi Ueki, Economist, ERIA, Dr. Nguyen Dinh Cung, President, Central Institute for Economic Management (CIEM), Viet Nam, Dato Abdul Latif Hj Abu Seman, Deputy Director Malaysia Productivity Corporation and Ms. Trinh Thu Thu Hien, Deputy Head, Division of Rules of Origin, Foreign Trade Agency, Ministry of Industry and Trade.</p><p class="pdf"><a href="http://www.eria.org/capacity_building/seminar_workshop/Press%20Release%20-%20Vietnam%20upgrades%20AEC%20capacity.pdf">Press Release - Vietnam upgrades AEC capacity</a></p><p class="pdf"><a href="http://www.eria.org/capacity_building/seminar_workshop/Press%20Release%20-%20ASEAN%20faces%20up%20the%20Post-2015%20challenges.pdf">Press Release - ASEAN faces up the Post-2015 challenges</a></p>";s:10:"image_name";s:50:"/uploads/articles/20140812/cb-ha-noi-2014-crop.jpg";s:9:"video_url";s:0:"";s:4:"tags";s:0:"";s:6:"editor";s:0:"";s:6:"author";s:0:"";s:6:"doc_no";s:0:"";s:6:"period";s:0:"";s:14:"article_status";s:1:"0";s:10:"event_time";s:5:"08:30";s:5:"venue";s:47:"Intercontinental Hanoi Westlake Hotel, Viet Nam";s:5:"major";s:0:"";s:16:"article_keywords";s:0:"";s:9:"organizer";s:0:"";s:12:"image_name_2";s:0:"";s:10:"start_date";s:10:"0000-00-00";s:8:"end_date";s:10:"0000-00-00";s:8:"keywords";s:4827:"Capacity Building Symposium 2014 in Ha Noi, Viet Nam on 'Upgrading Viet Nam's Position towards AEC 2015 and beyond' Capacity Building Symposium 2014 in Ha Noi, Viet Nam on 'Upgrading Viet Nam's Position towards AEC 2015 and beyond' CO-ORGANIZER

Ministry of Industry and Trade (MOIT) of Vietnam
Supported by

Central Institute for Economic Management (CIEM), Bangkok Research Center (BRC), JETRO Bangkok, JETRO, Ha Noi,
&nbsp;

Economic Research Institute for ASEAN and East Asia (ERIA) together with Ministry of Industry and Trade Viet Nam organized the ERIA Capacity Building Symposium in Ha Noi, Viet Nam, on August 12, 2014, supported by Central Institute for Economic Management (CIEM), Viet Nam, Bangkok Research Center (BRC), JETRO Bangkok and JETRO Ha Noi. The Symposium was held at Intercontinental Hanoi Westlake Hotel, Viet Nam.
The symposium focused on 'Upgrading Viet Nam's Position towards AEC 2015 and beyond'. Over 100 Vietnamese representatives from concerned ministries, private sectors and think-tanks attend the one-day symposium to promote their overall capacity to fulfill the economic integration under the ASEAN Economic Community (AEC).
The symposium also attended by H.E. Le Luong Minh, Secretary General of ASEAN to give his keynote speech, H.E. Nguyen Cam Tu, Deputy Minister, Ministry of Industry and Trade, Viet Nam and Prof. Hidetoshi Nishimura, Executive Director of ERIA
The prominent speakers for the symposium were Dr. Ponciano S. Intal Jr., Senior Researcher, ERIA, Dr. Vo Tri Thanh, Vice President, Central Institute for Economic Management (CIEM), Viet Nam, Mr. Nguyen Van Thach, Deputy Director General, Ministry of Transport, Viet Nam, Mr. Do Xuan Quang, Chairman, Vietnam Logistics Business Association, Mr. Atsushi Nagashima, President, Nippon Express (Viet Nam) Co., Ltd., Mrs. Bhui Thi Ngoc, General Director, Ngoc Ha, Viet Nam, Dr. Yasushi Ueki, Economist, ERIA, Dr. Nguyen Dinh Cung, President, Central Institute for Economic Management (CIEM), Viet Nam, Dato Abdul Latif Hj Abu Seman, Deputy Director Malaysia Productivity Corporation and Ms. Trinh Thu Thu Hien, Deputy Head, Division of Rules of Origin, Foreign Trade Agency, Ministry of Industry and Trade.

Daw Lei Lei Thein, Deputy Minister for National Planning and Economic Development and H.E. Dr. Aung Kyaw Myat, Deputy Minister of Science and Technology attended the symposium.</p><p>International and regional experts on IPR sharing their experience include Mr. Denis Croze, Director of World Intellectual Property Organization (WIPO), Singapore Office; Mr. Pornvit Sila-on, Head of International Cooperation Unit 1, Department of Intellectual Property, Ministry of Commerce, Thailand; Prof. Phan Quoc Nguyen, Vice-Director, Science, Technology and International Relations Department and Center of Knowledge Transfer, Viet Nam National University, Viet Nam; Prof. Rajah Rasiah, University of Malaya, Malaysia; Dr. Miranda Risang Ayu, New Emerging IPR Specialist, Universitas Padjajaran, Indonesia; Prof. Hiroshi Kato, Faculty of Law, Japan University; Dr. Moe Moe Thwe, Deputy Director, Head of Intellectual Property Section, Ministry of Science and Technology, the Republic of the Union of Myanmar; Mr. Takeo Donoue, Director-General, Policy Planning and Coordination Department, Japan Patent Office.</p><h2>Co-organiser</h2><p>Ministry of Planning and Economic Development (NPED) and Ministry of Science and Technology (MOST), the Republic of the Union of Myanmar</p><h2>Supported by</h2><p>Supported by Bangkok Research Center (BRC) JETRO Bangkok, Japan Patent Office (JPO) and JETRO Yangon</p><div class="clear">&nbsp;</div><p class="pdf"><a href="http://www.eria.org/capacity_building/seminar_workshop/Press%20Release%20-%20IPR%20Symposium_Nay%20Pyi%20Taw.pdf">Press Release - IPR Symposium_Nay Pyi Taw</a></p>";s:10:"image_name";s:50:"/uploads/articles/20140909/cb-nay-pyi-taw-crop.jpg";s:9:"video_url";s:0:"";s:4:"tags";s:0:"";s:6:"editor";s:0:"";s:6:"author";s:0:"";s:6:"doc_no";s:0:"";s:6:"period";s:0:"";s:14:"article_status";s:1:"0";s:10:"event_time";s:5:"08:00";s:5:"venue";s:36:"Thingaha Hotel, Nay Pyi Taw, Myanmar";s:5:"major";s:0:"";s:16:"article_keywords";s:0:"";s:9:"organizer";s:0:"";s:12:"image_name_2";s:0:"";s:10:"start_date";s:10:"0000-00-00";s:8:"end_date";s:10:"0000-00-00";s:8:"keywords";s:3903:"ERIA-Myanmar IPR Symposium on IPR for SME Development ERIA-Myanmar IPR Symposium on IPR for SME Development ERIA-Myanmar IPR Symposium on IPR for SME Development was held on Tuesday, 9 September, 2014 in Thingaha Hotel, Nay Pyi Taw, Myanmar.
Protection of intellectual property right (IPR) will attract foreign investment and promote innovation in the small and medium-size enterprises (SMEs) in Myanmar, according to a senior Myanmar official.
H.E. Daw Lei Lei Thein, Deputy Minister for National Planning and Economic Development and H.E. Dr. Aung Kyaw Myat, Deputy Minister of Science and Technology attended the symposium.
International and regional experts on IPR sharing their experience include Mr. Denis Croze, Director of World Intellectual Property Organization (WIPO), Singapore Office; Mr. Pornvit Sila-on, Head of International Cooperation Unit 1, Department of Intellectual Property, Ministry of Commerce, Thailand; Prof. Phan Quoc Nguyen, Vice-Director, Science, Technology and International Relations Department and Center of Knowledge Transfer, Viet Nam National University, Viet Nam; Prof. Rajah Rasiah, University of Malaya, Malaysia; Dr. Miranda Risang Ayu, New Emerging IPR Specialist, Universitas Padjajaran, Indonesia; Prof. Hiroshi Kato, Faculty of Law, Japan University; Dr. Moe Moe Thwe, Deputy Director, Head of Intellectual Property Section, Ministry of Science and Technology, the Republic of the Union of Myanmar; Mr. Takeo Donoue, Director-General, Policy Planning and Coordination Department, Japan Patent Office.

ERIA Capacity Building Seminar in Cambodia was held on Monday to Tuesday, 19-20 January 2015 in Intercontinental Phnom Penh, Cambodia.
This one and a half day seminar from 19 January to 20 January is part of ERIA Capacity Building Seminar programs on ASEAN Economic Community. ERIA has been useful for Cambodia in its effort to implement various blueprints under the ASEAN Community, especially in the economic pillar.
